paper_abstract: Agile software development implies major changes in the way you test software, from strategic project planning to day-to-day activities. While previous publications have focused on programmer-oriented practices, such as test-first programming, they've neglected many issues related to large-scale projects and to an organization's initial transition to agile methods. This article attempts to close this gap, reporting on the Israeli Air Force's Extreme Programming experiences in a large-scale, enterprise-critical software project.
paper_title: Agile software testing in a large-scale project
